description:
The redevelopment of the site by the erection of two three/
four storey linked buildings to provide B1 offices,
residential, retail and cafe floorspace with the retention
of the accumulator tower and horse steps and tunnel.
As shown on drawing nos. DP00-000; PP00-305, 306; DP19-005;
DP20-008, 009, 010, 011, 012, 013, 014, 205, 206, 207, 208,
311, PP20-310.
Agent's letters dated 2.12.1999 and 6.1.2000
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the [layout, sections, elevations and facing materials] to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. [Such details shall include proposed slab levels of the building in relation to the existing and proposed levels of the site and the surrounding land.] These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - The details of the [layout, sections, elevations and facing materials] to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. [Such details shall include proposed slab levels of the building in relation to the existing and proposed levels of the site and the surrounding land.] These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 3 - No development pf the proposed ramp and staircase down to
    the canal tow path shall begin before details have been
    submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, in
    consultation with British Waterways, and the details
    approved by the Council shall thereafter be implemented
    prior to occupation of the development.

Condition : 4 - No work shall be carried out on the accumulator tower, horse
    steps, and tunnel before details of their proposed
    restoration have been submitted to and approved in writing
    by the Council.

Condition : 5 - Details of all existing trees on site (and bordering the site within 10 metres) with a stem diameter of 75mm or greater shall be supplied to the Council prior to the consideration of detailed proposals and shall include the following information: Location, species, reference number, stem diameter at 1.5 metres above ground level, height and accurate crown spread. Where nearby excavations are proposed, the level at the base of each tree shall be included. Trees to be removed in conjunction with the proposed development should be indicated as such and, where appropriate the proposed positions and lines of protective fencing and prohibited areas should be shown. 

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies [EN15 if landscape details], [EN61 if trees only] [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council. [Such details shall include details of any proposed earthworks including grading, mounding and other changes in ground levels.] 

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies [EN15 if landscape details], [EN61 if trees only] [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 7 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details [by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development] [, prior to the occupation for the permitted use of the development or any phase of the development], whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 8 - The B1 accommodation hereby approved should be built to
    B1(c) standards on the ground floor.

Condition : 9 - The buildings shall not be occupied before details of the
    proposed extract ventilation system have been submitted to
    and approved in writing by the Council.

Condition : 10 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the [adjoining] premises [and the area generally] in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2[, EN5, EN6 and DS6] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - No music shall be played on the premises in such a way as to be audible within any adjoining premises or on the adjoining highway. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2 [and SH18 if A3 use] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - No food or drink shall be consumed on the premises outside
    the hours of 8.00 am to 11.00 pm on Mondays to Saturdays and
    8.00 am to 10.30 pm on Sundays or Bank Holidays.  No
    customers or members of staff shall be on the premises
    outside the hours of 8.00 am to 11.30 pm on Mondays to
    Saturdays and 11.00 pm on Sundays and Bank Holidays.

Condition : 13 - The buildings shall not be occupied before details of the
    proposed tables, chairs and litter bins on the cafe terrace
    have been submitted to and approved in writing by the
    Council.

Condition : 14 - Before the use commences, details of the method of storage and waste removal (including recycled materials) shall be submitted to and approved by the Council and the approved method shall thereafter be maintained.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the [adjoining] premises [and the area generally] in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2[, EN5, EN6, DS6 (and SH18 if A3 use)] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - The development shall not be occupied until the whole of the car parking provision shown on the approved drawings is provided. Thereafter the whole of the car parking provision shall be retained and used for no purpose other than for the parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the use of the premises does not add to parking pressures in surrounding streets which would be contrary to policies RE2 [and TR17 if residential] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 16 - The service lane shall at all times be kept clear of parked
    vehicles other than those involved in servicing the site or
    loading/unloading.

Condition : 17 - Contributions for amendments to traffic orders and the costs
    of installing crossovers are to be met by the applicants.
    This will include work to investigate the resiting of
    existing residential parking bays.

Condition : 18 - The scheme shall not be implemented other than in accordance
    with the details approved pursuant to the relevant
    conditions above.

Condition : 19 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 20 - To ensure that the external appearance of the development
    will be satisfactory and to ensure the safety of users of
    the site.

Condition : 21 - To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the
    character of the immediate area.

Condition : 22 - In order to safeguard the special architectural and
    historic interest of these features.

Condition : 23 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 24 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 25 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme.

Condition : 26 - So that the redevelopment hereby approved complies with
    Council policy.

Condition : 27 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 28 - In order to protect the amenities of the occupants of the
    buildings.

Condition : 29 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 30 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 31 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally, and the appearance of the site.

Condition : 32 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 33 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes in connection with the residential use and
    to ensure that the use of the building does not add to
    traffic congestion.

Condition : 34 - To ensure that the Council's policies and standards relating
    to parking are complied with, and to prevent an increase in
    traffic congestion.

Condition : 35 - To ensure that the developer meets the costs of the
    redevelopment.

Condition : 36 - To ensure that the development is implemented in accordance
    with the approved details.

Condition : 37 - In good time, prior to the start of construction (or if
    appropriate, demolition) on site, the contractor shall
    discuss and agree with the Council's Traffic Management
    Service (tel:020-7974 5629) detailed arrangements for
    the transportation of goods and materials to and from the
    site. The Council will prosecute those responsible for
    anybreaches of the provisions of the Highways and Litter
    Acts which occur as a result of construction on the site.

Condition : 38 - Camden Council is keen to form Travel Plan* Partnerships
    * A Travel Plan is a package of measures implemented by an
    employer, designed to reduce car use. The site based plans
    aims to support walking, cycling, public transport and car
    sharing/pool use.
    with the health sector and other businesses to reduce the
    negative impact of car users on the environment and people's
    health, as recommended by "The Health of Londoners" project
    in the report "Transport in London and the Implications for
    Health". If you are interested in working in partnership
    with the Council on the production of a Travel Plan, please
    contact Richard Finch in the Forward Planning and Projects
    Team on 020-7278 4444 ext 2520.

Condition : 39 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not take
    place other than between the hours of 08.00am to 18.00 pm on
    Monday to Friday and 08.00am to 13.00pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.

Condition : 40 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    control under the Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Environmental Commercial
    Service (Pollution Team), Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street,
    WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020 7278 4444), or to seek prior approval
    under Section 61 if you anticipate any difficulty  in
    carrying out construction other than within normal
    working hours and by means that would minimise disturbance
    to adjoining premises.

Condition : 41 - The details required pursuant to Condition(s) 1, 2, 3, 4, 5,
    6, 9,13, and 14 should be submitted with the attached
    approval of details application form together with 5 sets of
    drawings and any other supporting information.

Condition : 42 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 43 - The Council supports schemes for the recycling of bottles
    and cans and encourages all hotels, restaurants, wine bars
    and public houses to do so as well. Further information can
    be obtained by telephoning the Council's Street Environment
    Service (Recycling) on 020 7974 1553.

Condition : 44 - The applicants are reminded that works adjecent to the canal
    must comply with British Waterways Code of Practice.
